article.headline: VA Commonwealth 49, Richmond 37
article.story: RICHMOND, Va. (AP) -- Alexander Harper scored 10 second-half points and Richmond had one field goal in the final 9:37 Saturday as Virginia Commonwealth topped the Spiders 49-37. The 37 points matched the school record for fewest points: New Hampshire scored 37 against the Rams on Feb. 11, 1992. Virginia Commonwealth (4-2) never trailed. The Rams led by as many as six in the first half and had a 24-18 halftime lead. The Spiders (4-4) pulled the lead to within 34-33 on Gaston Moliva's tip-in with 9:37 remaining. On the Rams' next possession, Harper hit a followup -- the first of five straight Virginia Commonwealth baskets -- which gave the Rams a 47-33 lead with 5:25 remaining. Nick George led the Rams with 13 points, 11 in the first half. Harper finished with 12. Kevin Steenberge led the Spiders with eight points, all in the first half. Richmond committed 27 turnovers.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
